intro: Platylobium macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered burr-lilly, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae, which includes plants known for their striking, often fiery-colored flowers. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. Its seed pods are woody and ribbed, containing numerous small, hard seeds. Platylobium macrocalyx is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and heathlands.
